body:
System requirements macOS 11 Big Sur or later Installation Download dmg file from here. Open a downloaded dmg file. Move Tinkle.app into Applications. Open Tinkle from Launchpad. Accessibility Access dialog will be shown.
Click the Open System Preferences button.
(Tinkle uses the accessibility features in order to detect the focused window changes.) Enable Tinkle on System Preferences > Privacy > Accessibility. Finished!
A visual effect is shown when you change the focused window while Tinkle is running.
What’s next? Configuration
excerpt: System requirements macOS 11 Big Sur or later Installation Download dmg file from here. Open a downloaded dmg file. Move Tinkle.app into Applications. Open Tinkle from Launchpad. Accessibility Access …
title: Getting Started

body:
Tinkle keeps running in the background even if you close the preferences window.
To quit Tinkle, choose “Quit Tinkle” from menu bar.
Note If you’ve hidden the menu bar icon, you can also quit Tinkle from Preferences.
Open preferences window.
Press Quit Tinkle button.
excerpt:

To quit Tinkle, choose “Quit Tinkle” from menu bar.
Note If you’ve hidden the menu bar icon, you can also quit Tinkle …
title: How to quit Tinkle

body: Open Preferences from menu bar. Note If you’ve hidden the menu bar icon, open Tinkle again from Launchpad while Tinkle is already running to open preferences window.
excerpt: Open Preferences from menu bar. Note If you’ve hidden the menu bar icon, open Tinkle again from Launchpad while Tinkle is already running to open preferences window.
title: Open preferences window

body:
You can change the effect.
Open preferences window. Choose the effect. Effects Shock wave (blue)
Neon (blue)
excerpt:
You can change the effect.
Open preferences window. Choose the effect. Effects Shock wave (blue)
Neon (blue)
title: Effect configuration

body:
Remove Tinkle from your system as follows.
Quit Tinkle before uninstallaion. Open Applications folder in Finder, then move Tinkle to trash.
excerpt:
Remove Tinkle from your system as follows.
Quit Tinkle before uninstallaion. Open Applications folder in Finder, then move Tinkle to trash.
title: How to uninstall Tinkle

body: You can download older versions of Tinkle from Release notes
excerpt: You can download older versions of Tinkle from Release notes
title: Donwload older versions

body:
You can launch Tinkle automaticaly at login.
Open preferences window. Enable Open at login.
excerpt:
You can launch Tinkle automaticaly at login.
Open preferences window. Enable Open at login.
title: Open at login

body:
You can hide the icon in menu bar from preferences.
Open preferences window. Turn off Show icon in menu bar.
excerpt:
You can hide the icon in menu bar from preferences.
Open preferences window. Turn off Show icon in menu bar.
title: Hide the icon in menu bar

body: You can install beta version from Check for beta updates button on Misc tab.
excerpt: You can install beta version from Check for beta updates button on Misc tab.
title: Use beta version

body: Tinkle is an open source software and you can use it without any purchases.
excerpt: Tinkle is an open source software and you can use it without any purchases.
title: Pricing

body:
Tinkle A macOS app that appends a visual effect at the focused window changes. Download v2.1.0 Toggle Dropdown Download v2.1.0 For macOS 11 Big Sur or later Download v1.7.0 For macOS 10.15 Catalina Learn more Tinkle works on macOS 11 Big Sur or later. Release notes GitHub Tinkle highlights the focused window.
It helps you if you often lose sight of the focused window especially the window is switched by keyboard shortcuts. ✨ Multiple displays environment is fully supported.
✨ Delightful effects use macOS Metal API.
